text:
- [Jim Blakley] Carnegie
Mellon's one of the top
research universities in the world,

particularly known for the
computer science department.

So the Living Edge Lab
is one of the foremost

and original edge computing
research facilities
in the world.
Edge computing really requires low latency
and predictable networking
in order to support the requirements

that particular edge
native applications have.

So when you're building
a network of this kind
the most important partner you need
is a network equipment provider.
- [Joe Constantine] JMA Wireless is a
leading global innovator
in mobile wireless connectivity solutions.
JMA and AWS have been working together

for a couple of years to
solve key complex 5G use cases
for the industry

and the thought process is
to provide simple, efficient,

and easy-to-deploy and
operate private networks.
- [Jim Blakley] We were engaged with them

on a small pilot project
inside an indoor network.

As a result of that was,
we were thinking about

what we wanted to do
with the outdoor network,

we reached out to AWS and
asked to partner with them
on building up a network.

- [Joe Constantine]
This network enables CMU
to build cutting edge applications

and showcase the value of
5G and how to monetize it
for different use cases and applications.
- [Jim Blakley] It worked very smoothly.
The entire rollout was very clean.

I think we did the whole
turn-up of the network,

after construction was
complete, in less than a week.

- [Joe Constantine] With
JMA and AWS' open approach

to wireless technology,
CMU were able to actually

drive new studies and investigate
latency characteristics

to achieve better and
predictable performance
for edge applications.

- [Jim Blakley] So the
next big step for us
in the evolution of this network
is a move to 5G
in order to get the promised low latency

that 5G gives us over
our current 4G solution.
And so we selected equipment and systems

that would be easily
upgraded from 4G to 5G.
Both the core software
that's running on our Snowball Edge,
as well as the network equipment from JMA
is all pre-designed to be upgraded to 5G
when the products are available

and when we have the complete
solution for 5G end-to-end.
(upbeat music)
